windesheim.heading: HBO-ICT | Windesheim Flevoland (8/2015 - 6/2019).
windesheim.text: During the first year of my bachelors we learned a basis of IT skills. From the second year onwards we got to apply that knowledge at internships. I have done five internships, each spanning half a year. Which gave me a lot of experience working with different technologies, companies, and people. My minor, as part of this bachelor's, I chose to do abroad, studying for half a year at Wenzhou University in China.

capgemini.heading: Back-end developer | Capgemini (11/2019 - 5/2022).
capgemini.text: I worked on DigiD for Logius, which is one of Capgemini's customers. Here I worked on a variety of items like containerizing, splitting the monolith application into microservices, and connecting to eIDAS (European electronic identification). The thing I am most proud of is unofficially becoming the first point of contact for the Ops teams when they needed help or cooperation from the development teams.

cinnovate.heading: Back-end internship | Cinnovate (9/2017 - 1/2018).
cinnovate.text: In a team of interns we built a C# Library for Pozyx. Pozyx is hardware used for indoor location tracking. Cinnovate used this indoor location tracking their projects, mainly a self-driving wheelchair.

pwt.heading: Back-end developer | Perfect Web Team (2/2017 - 8/2019).
pwt.text: During my studies I worked as a part-time web and back-end developer. The work mostly consisted of making custom Joomla! components using OOP PHP, jQuery, Git and MySQL. As my graduation-internship I set up a CI/CD environment for Perfect Web Team.

the_valley.heading: Back-end internship | The Valley (9/2018 - 1/2019).
the_valley.text: During this internship I worked in a Scrum team, together we redesigned and rebuilt the website fcutrecht.nl.

content.free_time: After a day of work I enjoy hanging out on Discord and playing team-based games such as Overwatch, Apex Legends or League of Legends. During weekends I enjoy having board game nights or going out for a drink with friends.
content.learning: I am constantly looking to learn new things. During my free time I often browse Reddit, YouTube or listen to podcasts to learn more about things like Kubernetes, Front-end development and pentesting.

personal_summary.heading: Personal Summary
personal_summary.text: I am a 25 year old software developer. Besides my main specialization in back-end web development I enjoy working on a wide range of subjects. I take pride in being able to explain complex technical concepts in layman's terms. Because of ability I have often been asked by colleagues to collaborate with them on a variety of items, such as e.g. front-end, CI/CD automation, database administration, Linux server management, and incident response. In this way I see myself as a real team player, who is always ready to help others out.

li.agile: Agile, Scrum, SAFe: worked in professional Agile teams
li.cicd: Gitlab CI/CD, Jenkins, Github workflows: setup and further development of pipelines
li.docker: Docker, Docker-compose, Docker Swarm: containerized applications and hosted them in swarm or compose stacks
li.elk: ELK: basic understanding of ELK and creating dashboards in Kibana
li.javascript: Javascript, TypeScript, Angular, Stencil, jQuery: collaborated with colleagues and some hobby projects
li.uml: UML: able to create and read UML models

meta.description: I am a 25 year old software developer. Besides my main specialization in back-end web development I enjoy working on a wide range of subjects.
meta.title: Jor Sanders - Resume
